critique: The document is a legal order related to foreign assistance to Israel. The tone is formal and authoritative. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of confidence and security in the actions taken, both in the US and in Israel. There is an element of surprise in the sense that the order bypasses certain standard procedures. There is no indication of sadness, fear, or disgust. There may be a slight element of joy in the sense of accomplishment.
